name: Chengdu Wolong Valley International Golf Club

imageUrl.alt: Chengdu Wolong Valley International Golf Club
Chengdu Wolong Valley International Golf Club
Chengdu Wolong Valley International Golf Club
Chengdu Wolong Valley International Golf Club

description.text: One of the lesser known but better quality courses in the Sichuan region of southwestern China, the Chengdu Wolong Valley golf course was designed by American Rick Jacobson and first opened for play in 2012. The layout is dominated by sand, and prior to our visit we were told there were as many as 400 traps across the course. While this figure is plainly untrue, there is enough sand for 400 bunkers as the traps built are enormous, and literally everywhere. The great shame with Wolong Valley is that the obscene amount of sand tends to disguise what are otherwise nice, subtle golf shapes and holes. There are some interesting greens here and some effective strategy in amidst all the sand, but it is hard to identify because of the sheer size of the hazards. The bunkers themselves are rugged, well built and naturalistic in isolation, they are simply too prolific and spoilt conceptually by the fact that a course so full of sand looks anything but natural. Putting the sand to one side, highlights include a number of crested landing areas, the small, shapely putting greens and some of the more intimate individual bunkers. Traps short of the long par three 17th, for example, are unusually small for this course, but reasonably effective at framing the undersized, saddle green site. While we believe that Wolong Valley is likely the pick of the Chengdu golf courses, it certainly could have been better with a little more restraint shown during design and construction.

It is Phnom Penh's first and oldest golf course. opened in December 1996

The 7000 plus yard course is spreaded over an area of 120 acres
It is lined by sugar palm trees, native fruit, and evergreen plants, flowers and rocks

About 1 hour north of Phnom Penh’s dowwntown. along National Road #130 in Chhveang Village
Near the Royal Palace, National Museum, and the city’s myriad tourist attractions
Well-conditioned and emerging as one of the best golf courses in Phnom Penh
The par-72 golf course over 240 acres was opened in April 2013
Using Seashore Paspalum turf and operations management consulting by IMG is excellent and comparable with the top courses in the region
About 15 kilometers northeast of downtown Phnom Penh
A well-maintained  private members club
Designed by Nicklaus design
Located at the Grand Phnom Penh International City
About 20 minutes northwest of Phnom Penh and on the way to the airport

A flat course with different  condition amongst rice paddies and coconut palms
A favorite course  with locals and expatriates due to its location
Close to the  capital of Phnom Penh and only 8 kilometers from the Phnom Penh International Airport

About 15 km from the center of the capital, out skirt of the city
Includes two contrasting Nick Faldo designed 18-hole golf courses located
The par-72 East Course spread over 7,400 yards with scale models of pre-Angkorean structures including Preah Vihear Temple, Bayon Temple, and Angkor Wat

description.text: Championship course surrounded by black rocks
Located on the beautiful island of Belitung. It’s reachable within 45 minutes flight from Jakarta or one hour from Singapore, followed by a 20-minute ride from Tanjung Pandan Airport.
Black Rocks Hotel & Golf Club is a challenging course for all players.
A popular course conveniently located near Soekarno-Hatta International Airport
Traveler can golf and depart without having to rush into the city and deal with the traffic
Golfers can relax after golf in the comfort of clubhouse for their flight departure

description.text: The course is Jack Nicklaus forst course designed in Indonesia, opened in 1992
BSD has won many awards including the 1999 Best Golf Course in Indonesia and 2015 IAGTO Excellence
It is located located in the West Java satellite city of Bumi Serpong Damai
Consist of many Jack’s signature design of the undulating greens,and waste bunkers flanking the fairways

description.text: Designed by Robert Trent Jones Jr
Hosted tournaments for the 1983 World Cup and Indonesia Open in 2007 and 2010
Located close to the Java Sea and sometimes referred by locals as “The Spirit of the Sea
About 22 miles north of Damai Indah Golf’s other 18-hole layout, the Bumi Serpong Damai Course and around 30 minutes from the Jakarta International Airport
It is a challenging public course, designed by British course designer Desmond Muirhead.
Located in the new town of Lippo Karawaci, 25 minutes from downtown Jakarta and 35 minutes from Jakarta’s International Airport
The course is more difficult than most and plays to over 7200 yards from the back tees
It is one of the most challenging courses in Indonesia
It is situated 60 minutes from the center of Jakarta off the Jagorawi toll road
Three courses make up in a total of 45 holes
Both the Old Course and the New Course have hosted the Indonesian Open
A beautiful golf course in the heart of the city
The golf course blends into the natural  environment
The Championship course is the permanent home and venue for the Indonesian Masters.
Located just 15 minutes from central Jakarta and accessible via the toll road
A new Jakarta golf courses, designed as a world-class championship course from day one
A Jack Nicklaus designed hybrid links course
It is a “man-made links course”, like the New York’s Bayonne Golf Club
A new golf course in downtown Jakarta located in the Pantai Indah Kapuk area
Devloped by Agung Sedayu Group and Salim Group - Sedayu Indo

A complete makeover was done by JMP Group and course architect Bob Moore in 2012
Popular amongst local Indonesia golfers as it is in the heart of the central business district
